intro: Cyperus perangustus, commonly known as narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the sedge family, Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with triangular stems and narrow leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
